title: UPSTREAM: No pollution detection for PRs
description:
Moved from go-m4rd.

## Missing Feature
No bd preflight check exists to warn when personal issues would leak into upstream PRs.

## Evidence (v0.47.2)
- Existing preflight checks: merge/rebase, uncommitted JSONL, upstream tracking
- No check for contributor issues in PR context
- CheckTestPollution exists but only for test issues

## Impact
Contributors can accidentally pollute upstream PRs with personal issues.

## Phase
Part of contributor namespace isolation (Phase 3).

title: Infinite recursion in acquireStartLock (beads-cli)
description:
Moved from go-2loz.

## Bug Description
`acquireStartLock()` in beads-cli infinitely recurses when:
- Lock file exists (.beads/.daemon.lock)
- But daemon process is not running

This causes 1GB stack overflow (3,355,337 recursive frames).

## Location
- Repo: github.com/anthropics/beads (beads-cli)
- File: cmd/bd/daemon_autostart.go:228
- Function: acquireStartLock()

## Reproduction
Occurs in test environments where:
1. Temp directories used for beads
2. Lock file created but daemon not started
3. Any bd command triggers acquireStartLock

## Expected Behavior
Function should:
- Check if lock is stale (process not running)
- Remove stale lock and acquire new one
- NOT recurse indefinitely

Requires PR to anthropics/beads repo.

title: UPSTREAM: Auto-routing not applied in bd create
description:
Moved from go-o25x.

## Bug
Routing logic in bd create calculates target repo but IGNORES the result.

## Evidence (v0.47.2)
cmd/bd/create.go:325 - routing calculated
cmd/bd/create.go:328 - TODO(bd-6x6g) acknowledges bug
cmd/bd/create.go:330-332 - result only logged, not used

## Impact
Can't use contributor isolation workflow properly.

## Fix
Apply repoPath result instead of just logging it.
